author: Felicity Neptune
title: chevron-right
text: Strong to severe thunderstorms are possible which could produce large hail and strong winds. Expect heavy rainfall and lightning. ABILENE, Texas — Abilene ISD Advanced Placement art students will be awarded scholarships totaling $7,500 during an art exhibition. The Abilene Education Foundation will award $7,500 in scholarships to AISD art students during the 17th Annual AEF [Young Masters Juried Art Exhibition](https://www.aaeeff.org/young-masters/) at the Grace Museum. The Young Masters exhibition will be at the Grace Museum Thursday at 5 p.m. More than 85 pieces of artwork were submitted by students from Abilene High, Cooper High, and ATEMS. A jury and judge will choose the top winners of the exhibition and scholarships will be awarded. Selected artwork will be displayed at the Grace Museum from March 21 through April 6. The artwork will then be relocated to Abilene Teachers Federal Credit Union at 3849 Antilley Road. Adam Samuels, Executive Director of [Abilene Education Foundation](https://www.aaeeff.org/), said the Young Masters exhibition celebrates advanced art students as well as their teachers. “This competition recognizes outstanding artistic expression with a quality museum exhibition experience," said Samuels. "Young Masters shines a spotlight on talented young artists and guides students to premier higher education art programs.” The Abilene Education Foundation is a non-profit organization that aims to inspire and enhance excellence in education for students and teachers in Abilene ISD. The exhibition is put on by Abilene Education Foundation, Abilene ISD, the Grace Museum, the National Center for Illustrated Literature, and Abilene Teachers Federal Credit Union.
